channel.title: In game point and click editor (idea)
channel.description:
hey guys i was thinking about how to make a in-game point and click editor for the rs 317 client :cool:
what i was thinking about was that you right click on something and say it comes up with its i.d and theres an option to deleate and place. you could do this with npcs/objects/items.
this is only a mock pic so you can see what i mean...
[URL=http://img241.imageshack.us/my.php?image=mokpicgm8.png][IMG]http://img241.imageshack.us/img241/9774/mokpicgm8.th.png[/img][/URL] i dont no mutch java so thats why i posted this. it would be a great help for beginners
moderators, plese dont lock this.

item.title: In game point and click editor (idea)
item.dc:creator: @shrogg shrogg
item.description:
@shrogg wrote:

you dont have to have this in your server, you can have it seprately so the ppl playing on your server cant use it but you can offline. it would also make placeing items a lot faster. (ie, so you dont have to go into all the scripts to place stuff, and then you dont know if its placed properly or where you want it)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 17, 2009, 01:08:31 am[/size][hr]any 1 listening?

item.title: In game point and click editor (idea)
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

I dont know. I would just make a GUI, that loaded the map info from the client, then, calculate the in-game coordinates based on the mouse position in the screen, then edit it from there, saving the change into a MySQL Database… And to make it more dynamic, make the server load from a MySQL Database.

item.title: In game point and click editor (idea)
item.dc:creator: @Linksbro Linksbro
item.description:
@Linksbro wrote:

If I could figure out what the id’s and stuff are for right clicking on objects/the ground, You can easily implement a system where it spawns an object / deletes it.

I have a system already were the object list is loaded from a .txt, so using a BufferedWriter to delete that wouldn’t be that hard, I already have methods for writing in it.

I guess you could do the same with NPC’s also.

I will look into this.

zyle1992:

I know it wont work, he’d have to change alot of stuff in the server to make it work.

Not at all. Just a few statements to add the options to right-clicking, and then some methods for spawning/deleting stuff.

item.title: In game point and click editor (idea)
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Not that hard. just find in the server:
where it adds the trade option, or kick, or w/e is in your server
add another option the same way those are added
than go into the parseIncomingPackets
find the case for when that option is clicked
read the instream to find the X and Y of where you clicked
make it load the interface that asks “how many would you like to make?”
sendFrame126(“ID of what you would like to add”, #);//w/e the number is for that interface
take which option you picked, (Item, object, npc, or w/e), the X, Y, and ID.

if(option.equals("Npc")) {
    try {
        FileReader Read = new FileReader("./cfg/npc.cfg");//or wherever you have it load
        BufferedReader Reader = new BufferedReader(Read);
        String Line = Reader.readLine();
        while(Line != null) {
            if(Line.equalsIgnoreCase("[EOF]")) {
                Line.replace("[EOF]", PutYourNPCInformationHere);
                FileWriter Write = new FileWriter("./cfg/npc.cfg");
                BufferedWriter Writer = new FileWriter(Write);
                Writer.newLine();
                Writer.write("[EOF]");
                Writer.close();
            }
            Line = Reader.readLine();
        }
    }
    catch(Exception Error) {
    }
}

Or something along those lines. I just whipped that code off the top of my head. So don’t expect it to be perfect.

Also, if you want real-time results, you’re probably going to have to change your run code, so it loads the cfg files like every second or something. I’ts been a while since i worked with 317’s so i can’t remember all that well.

Read full topic

item.title: In game point and click editor (idea)
item.dc:creator: @GeneriC GeneriC
item.description:
@GeneriC wrote:

ok ill translate from your poor en so you will say em i right.
You mean add some menu or command that can spawn
delete or change object/item or npc right?

Not bad idea, but need to work on configs like if you want
it to be placed at config, else its only momentarele spawns(until rr)
so we need to make something like to write stuff in config
also make loader at client.java that checks it.

Not impossible but hard maybe.
NOTE: There are commands that spawn items,mobs objects.
NOTE2: The idea would be to add an interface like this:

                                             |--------------------------------------------------------|
                                             |                 Choose what you want to create:                 |
                                             |                                                                               |
                                             |                                       NPC                                   |
                                             |                                    Item drop                              |
                                             |                                     Object                                 |
                                             |                                       Exit                                   |
                                             |--------------------------------------------------------|

right?

If npc item drop or object we would need to add some interface
that is empty box and you write the id of npc click ok
other menu with selection of cords
(your staying ones or the ones that you will enter at next menu)
Then click ok and it ends. NPC created…

Same with objects just adding face and height level(depending on what it is floor dec/stand object/wall)

If i will code it ill put it on bluecore and for idea creds will be yours shrogg

Read full topic
